Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2008 05:56PM KevinK wrote: Just an update to my posts I had an appointment today at the Canadian cancer society to gather more information and try to get ready for what is coming and I have decided that after all the wonderful posts I am gonna try and have a fund raising event for breast cancer research and all the people who posted in this thread are my inspiration for this I have called a few musician friends and they are all very enthusiastic about it and I even have 3 coporate sponsors I am not gonna post any of the info here but to those who live in Ontario Canada I will leave my e-mail here for you to contact me. I feel like a man possesed with this project. My heart goes out to you Jennifer and your husband I know you have been dealing with this longer than my lovely girlfried and I cannot even fathom the pain this is causing you or any of the others who have this affliction ( i dont know how else to put it ) keep faith and stay strong is all I can say. I got an interesting comment out of my discussions with the CCS and it help put things in perspective for me so maybe it will help the men who are reading this. I had told the woman I was talking to that I was feeling really helpless and useless and she said "Of course you are most men want to be able to FIX IT and when they cannot they get confused and angry " and just hearing that from a woman who is a survivor really helped me to calm down and just think things through. To all of you who posted you are amazing to me and I wish you all the best in the future truly Much love to you all You folks are very inspirational and they more I read the more I admire you all for those interested in the fundraiser my e-mail is kevinwkipp@hotmail.com Love you all Kevin

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2008 12:17PM KevinK wrote:  Well we got the news that her cancer is invasive and she is going in for surgery on the 27th of this month for a lumpectomy and I am even more confused and scared for her than I was before mostly because they are moving so fast.When we were in the Drs office the doctor said that she would call and let us know the time and date for surgery and then before we left we had all the info..............man that is fast... Karen has gone in for her bone scan and it was clean and she is going in for ct scan on tuesday and then surgery on wednesday. I keep finding myself at a loss for words even when she is not around. All my friends and hers are calling and I find myself more and more worried with every call and I cannot imagine what she is going through. cliches even elude me.I dont know what the heck I am supposed to do or say and I know that doing and saying nothing is of little use. From a mans perspective this is so hard to comprehend I cannot imagine how it is to live it from a womans. Keep strong and have faith Love you all Kevin

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2008 01:43PM KevinK wrote: Karen has just had her second surgery she had the lump in her breast removed and the removed 1 node from her armpit the tissue surrounding the lump came up cancer free but the node did not.So today she has had her second surgery and and had all the nodes in her armpit removed and now I do not know what to expect I have had alot of people telling me stuff but none have ever expierienced this before so what do they know. She has an appointment with the cancer clinic next week and as far as I know she will be getting hormone therapy as well as radiation.All this seems so much worse because I came down with the flu 2 days ago and could not be with her today or yesterday as I did not want to risk her getting that as well. My little brother is spending the night at her place to watch over her for me.My lord she has been understanding and she has been very tolerent of people telling her what to expect but sooner or later I am sure she is gonna breakdown as she has not yet. What can I do to help her through all the hormone therapy and radiation? is it Chemo or radiation that causes hair loss? she is really concerned about this Much love Kevin

Posts.Content: KevinK wrote: I just finished reading a few posts and I am not sure if this is a womens only forum but after reading a few of the posts I am not any clearer on how to help the woman I love. I know that hearing "your a fighter" or "it will be alright" or better yet "you will make it through this" does not help and that is all I want to do. I know that this is her fight and she has to fight it for the most part on her own but that does not mean I cant be her cornerman and stand by her while she goes through all of this. That is not the hard part for me the hard part is what do I say to her to let her know that I love her and will be with her through all of it? I am soo confused and scared for her and all I want to do is make her understand that no matter what happens I am here. Now I know in some small way this seems to be a selfish kind of post but I do not want to pummel her with all the cliches that others will I want her to know that she is not alone.
